page.title: 20PLACES OF INTEREST_DUNDONALD
page.content: If you are visiting our area of Dundonald and surrounding countryside, there are many places of interest for you to see. In fact, if you are a treasure seeker, then you might be interested in a local legend which tells us of buried treasure up in the glen behind the village. In times of stress,it is said, the monks who lived there used to bury their valuables somewhere there and they have never been found! Apart from the famous{Dundonald {Castle, }there is another castle called {Old Auchans Castle}nearby. This castle was built in the 17th Century by the Wallaces and later became part of the Eglinton Estates. This castle too is now a ruin, but well worth a visit. On the road between Loans and Dundonald there is an{ancient fort.}
